title: How Many Calories in a Spoonful of Sugar?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in spoonful of sugar, including carbs, sugars, and nutrition facts per serving, plus variations and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories in a Spoonful of Sugar?
assumptions: Granulated white sugar; 1 spoonful = 1 level teaspoon (4 g).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by sugar type, granule size, packing density, and measurement; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A spoonful of sugar contains about 16 calories, all from carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a teaspoon of sugar?
faqs.a: About 16 calories for 1 level teaspoon (4 g) of granulated sugar.

faqs.q: Is a spoonful of sugar the same as a teaspoon?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 1 spoonful means 1 teaspoon, or 4 g.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a spoonful of sugar?
faqs.a: Fully 4 g of carbohydrates, all as sugars, with 0 g fiber.

faqs.q: How many calories in a tablespoon of sugar?
faqs.a: Around 48 calories for 1 level tablespoon (12 g).

faqs.q: Does sugar type affect calories per spoonful?
faqs.a: Slightly; white granulated is ~16 kcal, brown ~17 kcal per teaspoon.
